headline: CVS shares jump on raised profit outlook for 2025
summary:
STORY: EDITOR'S NOTE:THIS STORY WAS REFILED TO CORRECT A LINE SAYING THE COMPANY'S PROFIT FORECAST TOPPED ESTIMATES

Shares of CVS rose as much as five percent Tuesday morning after the company raised its 2025 profit outlook for the fourth time.

CEO David Joyner said at the company’s investor day that CVS has delivered on its promises this year and will now focus on improving consumer experiences across the business.

He added, "We've invested heavily in what I would believe is the challenge in the marketplace, which is a lack of trust."

The upbeat outlook caps a year in which Joyner pushed through a sweeping overhaul, which involved cutting costs, exiting underperforming markets, and strengthening management to revive investor confidence.

CVS shares have responded with gains of more than 70% this year.

CVS said in May that it plans to exit the market for Obamacare health insurance plans in 2026, as rising medical costs have pressured health insurers in recent quarters.

The company expects its Aetna insurance business and CVS Caremark pharmacy benefit management unit to drive growth, as their profit margins are expected to return to target levels.

Analysts at Leerink Partners said in a note that, "CVS' near-term momentum should set the stage for what remains a robust growth recovery story.”

headline: How Recent Shifts Are Rewriting the Story for CVS Health
summary: CVS Health’s narrative has shifted with a slightly higher fair value estimate, nudging from about $91.50 to roughly $92.40 per share as analysts factor in modestly stronger long term revenue growth assumptions. While the discount rate has ticked up from around 7.18% to about 7.35%, reflecting a marginally higher required return amid lingering industry risks, updated research still leans constructive given improving earnings visibility and expectations for medium term margin recovery. Stay...

headline: 3 Reasons CVS is Risky and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: CVS Health’s 22.1% return over the past six months has outpaced the S&P 500 by 8.7%, and its stock price has climbed to $78.44 per share. This was partly thanks to its solid quarterly results, and the performance may have investors wondering how to approach the situation.
